venue.name: GSU Conference Auditorium at Boston University

item.description:
A night of literature & spoken word readings to benefit the Red Cross relief effort in Japan, featuring Fred Marchant, Tim Gager, Speak for Yourself slam poets, student writers from BU and Emerson College, and an open mic for those who wish to voice their response to the 2011 Tohoku disaster. Suggested donation: $5. All proceeds will go to the Red Cross fund for Japan recovery and relief.

Sponsors for this event include the BU Literary Society; the BU Japanese Student Association; the UnStandard arts initiative; the BU Speak for Yourself slam society; Clarion Magazine; and ARABIKI International Journal of Poetry.

For more information,contact buwriter@bu.edu or call 617-935-4951.

Please circulate the URL for our Facebook event page in order to support our efforts to promote this fundraiser, even if you are unable to attend personally: http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=166514866736270
item.why: literary imagination enlivens our moral consciousness.
item.name: Words for Japan
